Package com.intellij.openapi.externalSystem.settings

Interface ExternalSystemSettingsListener<S extends ExternalProjectSettings>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - target project setting type
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    GradleSettingsListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DelegatingExternalSystemSettingsListener, DelegatingGradleSettingsListenerAdapter, ExternalSystemSettingsListenerAdapter, GradleSettingsListenerAdapter

    public interface ExternalSystemSettingsListener<S extends ExternalProjectSettings>
    Defines callback for external system settings change.

    Implementations of this interface are not obliged to be thread-safe.

        void onProjectRenamed(java.lang.String oldName,

        Parameters:
        oldName - old project name
        newName - new project name

      • onBulkChangeStart

        void onBulkChangeStart()
        External system settings changes might affect project structure, e.g. switching from one external system version to another one can trigger new binaries usage (different external system versions might use different file system directories for holding dependencies).

        So, we might want to refresh project structure on external system setting change. However, there is a possible case that more than one significant setting is changed during single editing session (e.g. a user opens external system settings, changes linked project path and 'use auto-import' and then presses 'Ok'.). We don't want to trigger two refreshes then. That's why it's possible to indicate that settings are changed in bulk now.

        onBulkChangeEnd() is expected to be called at the 'finally' section which starts just after the call to current method.

      • onBulkChangeEnd

        void onBulkChangeEnd()
        See Also:
        onBulkChangeStart()
